name: The Block
title: The Scoop Rising Political Risks And Renewed Macro Uncertainty Soften Postelection Surge
text:
Synopsis
Emerging political and macroeconomic risks are creating uncertainty in the crypto market, potentially softening the post-election rally and impacting investor sentiment.

Key Insights
- Cryptocurrency exchange volume reached $2.94 trillion in December, an 8.5% increase from November
- Mid-tier exchanges like BitGet (volume doubled to $178 billion) and OKX ($177 billion) are showing significant growth
- Political landscape suggests potential regulatory softening towards crypto, with hopes for a more cooperative approach from regulatory agencies
- Goldman Sachs indicates increased probability (nearly 30%) of an equity market drawdown
- Inflation concerns are resurfacing, which could slow the Federal Reserve's anticipated rate-cutting cycle
- Potential Trump tariff policies could further exacerbate inflationary pressures
- Investors may adopt a more cautious, risk-off stance leading into the 2025 inauguration
